newsitem.title: USA: WHX begins tender offer for Dynamics Corp.
newsitem.headline: WHX begins tender offer for Dynamics Corp.

text.p: WHX Corp. said Monday it began a cash tender offer for the stock of Dynamics Corp. of America at $40 apiece to increase its stake in the appliance and equipment manufacturer to 19.9 percent.
WHX, which already owns 109,600 Dynamics shares, said its tender offer is for up to 649,000 shares.
The Pittsburgh-based steelmaker said it would buy fewer shares if Dynamics amends its "poison pill" anti-takeover defence trigger to below 20 percent.
Dynamics' stock jumped $4 to $37.125, while WHX was unchanged at $7 on the New York Stock Exchange at mid-morning.

WHX said that late last week it sent a letter to Dynamics proposing a cash merger at $40 per share, or a total of about $160 million. In that proposal, WHX said it was prepared to raise its offer if Dynamics could prove that it was worth more.
The offer expires on April 29, it said.
WHX said the offer is not subject to any minimum number of shares being tendered or to financing. As of Dec. 31, it said it had more than $400 million of available cash and cash equivalents.
Dynamics, based in Greenwich, Conn., makes a variety of electrical appliances and electronic devices, fabricated metal products and equipment, and power and controlled environmental systems.
